title: Gower Surf & Coasteer
tagline: Wales' original AONB, waves and cliffs
suitableFor: Active couples and friends who enjoy outdoor adventures and aren't afraid of a bit of a challenge. Must be comfortable in the water.
notSuitableFor: Those with limited mobility, a strong aversion to cold water, or those seeking a purely relaxing holiday.

stops.title: Surfing Lesson
stops.description: Learn to ride the waves at Llangennith, one of Gower's best surfing beaches. Includes instruction and board hire.

wetAlt.title: National Waterfront Museum (Swansea)
wetAlt.description: Explore Swansea's maritime history at this indoor museum. Great for a rainy day.

budgetAlt.title: Bodyboarding at Llangennith
budgetAlt.description: Rent a bodyboard and enjoy the waves at Llangennith Beach.

stops.title: The Beach House Restaurant
stops.description: Enjoy fresh seafood with stunning views of Oxwich Bay. A popular spot for lunch.

budgetAlt.title: Packed lunch at Three Cliffs Bay
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy your lunch with fantastic views

stops.title: Coasteering with Quest Adventure
stops.description: Explore the Gower coastline from a unique perspective, scrambling, swimming, and jumping into the sea. Wetsuit and safety gear provided.

wetAlt.title: LC Swansea
wetAlt.description: Indoor waterpark with slides and pools. Good fun for all ages.

budgetAlt.title: Coastal walk to Three Cliffs Bay
budgetAlt.description: Hike along the cliffs to Three Cliffs Bay and enjoy the views.

stops.title: The King Arthur Hotel
stops.description: Traditional hotel in Reynoldston, a good base for exploring the Gower. Offers comfortable rooms and a restaurant.

budgetAlt.title: Llangennith Campsite
budgetAlt.description: Camping with basic facilities. A cheap option close to the beach.

stops.title: The Britannia Inn
stops.description: Traditional pub food in a relaxed atmosphere.

budgetAlt.title: Cook your own dinner at the campsite
budgetAlt.description: Bring your own food and enjoy a simple meal

stops.title: Walk to Worm's Head
stops.description: Walk across the causeway to Worm's Head at low tide and explore this unique tidal island. Check tide times before you set off!

wetAlt.title: Gower Heritage Centre
wetAlt.description: Learn about the Gower's history and heritage at this interesting centre. Has indoor and outdoor exhibits.

budgetAlt.title: Explore Rhossili Bay
budgetAlt.description: Walk along the beach and admire the views of Rhossili Bay.

stops.title: The Bay Bistro & Coffee House
stops.description: Casual cafe with sandwiches and ice cream.

budgetAlt.title: Picnic at Rhossili Downs
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy your lunch with a fantastic view from the top of the hill.

stops.title: SUP Boarding at Oxwich Bay
stops.description: Enjoy the calm waters of Oxwich Bay on a Stand Up Paddleboard. Great for all levels of experience.

wetAlt.title: Swansea Museum
wetAlt.description: Explore Swansea's history at this interesting museum.

budgetAlt.title: Swim at Oxwich Bay
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy a swim in the sea

knowBeforeYouGo.weather: Gower weather can be unpredictable. Be prepared for sunshine and showers, especially outside of summer. Check the forecast before you go.
knowBeforeYouGo.traffic: Traffic can be heavy on the A4118, especially during peak season. Allow extra time for travel. Parking at popular beaches can fill up quickly â€“ arrive early or consider using public transport.
knowBeforeYouGo.booking: Coasteering and surfing lessons should be booked in advance, especially during school holidays. Accommodation also books up quickly, so reserve early to avoid disappointment.
knowBeforeYouGo.fitness: A moderate level of fitness is required for coasteering and walking. Be prepared for some scrambling and swimming. Check tide times for the walk to Worm's Head.
